alert.note: Alert for Inland Cameron (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 4:14PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Cameron County through 515 PM CDT... At 414 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Brownsville Fire Department Station Seven, or near Downtown Brownsville, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Los Fresnos, Rancho Viejo, Cameron Park, Laureles, Downtown Brownsville, Southmost, Olmito, Brownsville, Lincoln Park and B I S D Administration Building. This includes the following highways... Interstate Highway 69 E between mile markers 1 and 12. US Highway 281 between mile markers 830 and 838. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
